title: (No.32 of 2012)) of the Industrial Relations Act 1946 (No. 26 of 1946) and being
heading: 4. This Order gives effect to the proposals set out in the Schedule.
text_raw:
4. This Order gives effect to the proposals set out in the Schedule. 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
"Iris Oifigiúil" of 18th July, 2025. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [326] 3 

[Proposed Amended Minimum Rates of Pay for an Employment Regulation 
Order for the Security Industry as adopted by the Security Industry Joint Labour 
Committee in January 2025. This proposal seeks to amend Sl. No. 319 of 2024] 

That paragraph (1) of Section 1 of Part II of Employment Regulation Order 
(Security Industry Joint Labour Committee) S.l. No. 319 of 2024 is hereby 
amended by – 

the substitution of the figure of €14.50 with the figure of €15.41. 

That paragraph (2) of Section 1 of Part II of Employment Regulation Order 
(Security Industry Joint Labour Committee) S.l. No. 319 of 2024 is hereby 
amended by – 

the substitution of: 

From the date of this Order, a minimum payment of €12.60 per shift. 

To increase to €16.80 per shift — from 1st January 2025 

To increase to €20.00 per shift —from 1st January 2026 

For clarity, those currently not in receipt of an unsocial hours premium or in 
receipt of an unsocial hour's premium of less than €12.60 per shift, must receive 
a minimum payment of €12.60 per shift where three hours are worked from the 
date of this Order. Existing unsocial premium payments in excess of €12.60 per 
shift will not increase or decrease as per section 21 of this agreement until the 
appropriate date as above. 

with the following: 

Increase to €20.00 per shift — from 1 January 2026 

GIVEN under my hand, 
 15 July 2025 

ALAN DILLON, 
 Minister of State at the Department of Enterprise, Tourism and 

Employment 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 4 [326]

title: (No.32 of 2012)) of the Industrial Relations Act 1946 (No. 26 of 1946) and being
heading: (This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation.) 

This Order fixes the statutory minimum rates of remuneration and other 
conditions of employment for Security Industry workers.
